snippet: The Jewish roots and Israeli past of Steven J. Sotloff, a journalist from Miami, were kept hidden until hope for his survival was no longer possible.
abstract: Family of Steven J Sotloff, American journalist from Miami who was beheaded by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, discloses that he held Israeli citizenship and had lived in the country for a time; say as long as there was a chance Sotloff was still alive, they kept his Israeli connection hidden, fearing exposure of his Jewish roots could put him in further danger.
lead_paragraph: The Jewish roots and Israeli past of Steven J. Sotloff, a journalist from Miami, were kept hidden until hope for his survival was no longer possible.

headline.main: Steven Sotloff, U.S. Hostage Slain by ISIS, Was Also a Citizen of Israel
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hostage Killed by ISIS Was a Citizen of Israel, Too
